Very good strategy game although sometimes it is very frustrating!

You either have a great day/game or throw your computer out the window onto the lawn. Single tapping and owning the field and 5 minutes later you can't figure out which end the bullets come out of. Stressful, fun, rewarding IF you get a kill. Toxic community whether you're good or bad or whatever.

Ah, yes. The competitive shooter that we all have come to play at LEAST once at our lives.

CSGO is a tactic team-shooter between two nations, Terrorist and Counter-Terrorist (hence the Counter-Strike). If your someone coming from previous or alternative titles from Valve (say, TF2 or even the older Counter-Strike), you'll find this game rather fun... Especially if you've played the original Counter-Strike in the past because this is mostly based around that, instead this game is more along the lines of actual tournament/competitive gameplay. Not to mention the fact that this game brings a completely outstanding graphic overhaul with the SourceEngine.

The only issue you'll be facing is the large amount of hackers/exploiters in the normal-free to play mode, those who have bought Prime-Status WILL be able to play with people who HAVE Prime-Status. Or in other words, you won't be encountering as much hackers as in the normal free-to-play queue...

If you like this game to a point where you want to play competitively (like most other games being played, say, Overwatch, Dota 2, and or TF2)... You should buy the priority part of this game just so you'll have the true experience of a team-shooter.
